scope_of_work.problem: The 10x NHB York Chiller condensers' coils require cleaning.
scope_of_work.scope: Isolate Chiller (only 1x Chiller to be isolated at one time). Remove acoustic panels. Clean condenser coils. Replace acoustic panels. Restart Chiller. x10
scope_of_work.justification: The Chillers' efficiency is reduced due to the condensers' coil condition and increases the risk of Chiller failure.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Operating with clogged condenser coils increases the risk of Chiller failure and subsequent reduction to site resilience.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: FET (Fixed electrical testing) is used to ensure the safety and compliance of electrical installations in accordance with UK health and safety law. It involves the testing and inspection of all electrical wiring and systems between the incoming electrical supply and final circuits within a building. On Multiple Distribution Boards across the site we have elapsed or are coming to our 5 year due date, to undertake our FET testing.
scope_of_work.scope:
Specialist Contractor (Drakeset) will have 2 x Operatives, attend site for a duration of 9 weeks this also includes 2 x Saturdays  for 2 x operatives.

This includes checking main panels, distribution boards, lights, plug sockets and air conditioning, it does not include equipment that is plugged in. Testing involves visual inspections and electrical tests on all systems in the building. All circuits should have a - insulation resistance test, a R1 R2 test, A Earth Loop Test & a PFC Test.
Circuits shall be identified and isolated for dead tests to take place, then reinstated for live tests. On dual feed equipment and in critical areas we shall follow a FSP, and isolate dual fed circuits so, point of test is safe to do so.
scope_of_work.justification:
Fixed wire testing checks the condition of the electrics against the UK standard for the safety of electrical installations, BS 7671. Each circuit’s cable and accessories is inspected for visual damage and wear and tear, followed by a series of tests to verify the wiring is safe and the circuit is wired correctly.

Failure to have an up-to-date EICR means you cannot prove you have undertaken the legally required assessment. This means you may be liable for any electrical accident and be at risk of prosecution.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Fixed wire testing checks the condition of the electrics against the UK standard for the safety of electrical installations, BS 7671. Each circuit’s cable and accessories is inspected for visual damage and wear and tear, followed by a series of tests to verify the wiring is safe and the circuit is wired correctly.

Failure to have an up-to-date EICR means you cannot prove you have undertaken the legally required assessment. This means you may be liable for any electrical accident and be at risk of prosecution.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Eryn Reichert (2):rejected by Eryn Reichert (3):offer submitted by Eryn Reichert

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Specialist reports have identified the Generator fuel requires polishing to restore condition to BS: EN590
scope_of_work.scope:
Specialist contractor to attend site during normal working hours to clean/polish the existing fuel in 4x Generator bulk fuel storage tanks to BS: EN590 standard.

Fuel tanks capacities:
Gen 1 (ARN 54309) - 40,000 litres (Samples EKVMD and QOPOA)
Gen 2 (ARN 54310) - 40,000 litres (Samples GATTW and AUXPY)
Gen 3 (ARN 54311) - 40,000 litres (Samples PEGHC and EREUL)
Gen 4 (ARN 54312) - 40,000 litres (Samples OYQLR and JCIOU)

The polishing process uses a unique system that allows for the fuel to be polished in situ eg: removing the need for external tanks/tankers.

Internal walls of the fuel tanks to be cleaned at the same time using Clear Tank System.
scope_of_work.justification: The Generator fuel from all 4x bulk storage tanks has been laboratory tested with recommendations to polish the fuel and restore condition to BS: EN590.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Water contaminated or dirty fuel can cause the following:

- Risk of diesel bug growing within fuel and all related lines and filters.
- Incorrect running of the Generator.
- Generator cut out.
- Generator hydraulic issues causing major internal failure.
- Fuel equipment failure.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Eryn Reichert (2):offer submitted by Eryn Reichert

scope_of_work.notes:

scope_of_work.problem: Specialist reports have identified the Generator fuel requires polishing to restore condition to BS: EN590
scope_of_work.scope:
Specialist contractor to attend site during normal working hours to clean/polish the existing fuel in 4x Generator bulk fuel storage tanks to BS: EN590 standard.

Expected duration of works - 2 weeks. CBRE support labour to include:

4hrs (DC Tech - grade F) - access control, badging and inductions
20hrs (DC Tech - grade F) - Permits start/close of each day
8hrs (DC TEch - grade F) - witness tests
20hrs (DC Tech - grade F) - escorting (Critical Environments)


Fuel tanks capacities:
Gen 1 (ARN 54309) - 40,000 litres (Samples EKVMD and QOPOA)
Gen 2 (ARN 54310) - 40,000 litres (Samples GATTW and AUXPY)
Gen 3 (ARN 54311) - 40,000 litres (Samples PEGHC and EREUL)
Gen 4 (ARN 54312) - 40,000 litres (Samples OYQLR and JCIOU)

The polishing process uses a unique system that allows for the fuel to be polished in situ eg: removing the need for external tanks/tankers.

Internal walls of the fuel tanks to be cleaned at the same time using Clear Tank System.
scope_of_work.justification: The Generator fuel from all 4x bulk storage tanks has been laboratory tested with recommendations to polish the fuel and restore condition to BS: EN590.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Water contaminated or dirty fuel can cause the following:

- Risk of diesel bug growing within fuel and all related lines and filters.
- Incorrect running of the Generator.
- Generator cut out.
- Generator hydraulic issues causing major internal failure.
- Fuel equipment failure.
